Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the protests by stating that news reports of "large" anti-President Trump protests are "fake news," when in reality, there were indeed thousands of protesters.
Understate: The claim understates the number of protesters by falsely stating that President Trump only saw a "very, very small group" of protesters.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it contradicts the evidence provided by major news organizations, including images and videos, that confirm the presence of thousands of protesters.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that if President Trump did not see the protests, they did not exist, or that reports of the protests are "fake news."
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the protests were not visible to President Trump due to security barriers and the placement of the demonstrators.
